channel.title: Problem connecting from the same subnet
channel.description: ok i can connect to my server just fine from my computer, but the other computers in my household can't and get an error message saying "Error connecting to server". If anyone knows why i can't connect from the same subnet please tell me.

item.title: Problem connecting from the same subnet
item.dc:creator: @Rufio Rufio
item.description:
@Rufio wrote:

i am using utorrent. i couldn’t portforward with my router.
i can’t connect to my server on my computer with my no-ip. i have to leave it blank or use 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 but anything else that would make it where i can’t connect on the same subnet?
and i’ll try with my ip address

i am also going to see if theres anything disabling them from connecting with my computer
there probably is since i had to recently reinstall windows xp and it probably is some stupid default setting but thanks [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 02, 2008, 03:18:34 pm[/size][hr]is there another way to find out my ip address, i’ll check my router and see if says it there ipconfig doesnt work for me
i have followed like 8 tuts on how to get it working but i gave up it’s not that important to me anyways

Read full topic
item.source: Problem connecting from the same subnet

item.title: Problem connecting from the same subnet
item.dc:creator: @Project_Revolution Project Revolution
item.description:
@Project_Revolution wrote:

@ Olzax:

IT DOESN’T WORK LIKE THAT…TRUST ME
Plus you don’t have to port forward for you household computers to join…

This happened to me…

First of all, your other computers cant use 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0 or leave it blank because their computer isn’t running the server. Next you need to find YOUR local ip address for them to connect to. One way to do this is to open the start menu, press run and type “cmd” without the " 's when you cmd is open, type ipconfig. It should say:

Local Area Connection: IP Address . . . . . . . ###.###.#.##

use that ip adress for the other computers to log into your server…

If it still does not work continue reading…

If you have any security program blocking/disallowing your other computers to connect to your computer disable them or make it so they can connect by allowing them to…

HOPE I HELPED…
BTW: took me like 5 mins to write this…Would have been 3rd post =[

-Project Revolution

Read full topic

try portforwarding with utorrent, then you can connect to your server with your no-ip on any computer
